title: 59th Annual Grammy Awards
text:
The 59th Annual Grammy Awards ceremony was held on February 12, 2017. The <a href="CBS">CBS</a> network broadcast the show live from the <a href="Staples%20Center">Staples Center</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>. The ceremony recognized the best recordings, compositions, and artists of the eligibility year, which ran from October 1, 2015, to September 30, 2016.
<a href="James%20Corden">James Corden</a> hosted the ceremony for the first time. The pre-telecast ceremony (officially named The Premiere Ceremony) was held on the same day prior to the main event and was hosted by comedian <a href="Margaret%20Cho">Margaret Cho</a>.
The nominations were announced on December 6, 2016. <a href="Beyonc%C3%A9">Beyoncé</a> acquired the most nominations with nine. <a href="Drake%20%28musician%29">Drake</a>, <a href="Rihanna">Rihanna</a>, and <a href="Kanye%20West">Kanye West</a> received eight nominations each, while <a href="Chance%20the%20Rapper">Chance the Rapper</a> followed with seven nominations. <a href="Tom%20Elmhirst">Tom Elmhirst</a> won six awards from six nominations as an engineer/mixer. Among the artists, <a href="Adele">Adele</a> was the biggest winner of the night with five trophies, including <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Album%20of%20the%20Year">Album of the Year</a> for "<a href="25%20%28Adele%20album%29">25</a>", <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Record%20of%20the%20Year">Record of the Year</a>, and <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Song%20of%20the%20Year">Song of the Year</a> for "<a href="Hello%20%28Adele%20song%29">Hello</a>". Adele also became the first musician in history to win all three general field awards in the same ceremony twice, previously winning all three categories in <a href="54th%20Annual%20Grammy%20Awards">2012</a>. <a href="David%20Bowie">David Bowie</a> and <a href="Greg%20Kurstin">Greg Kurstin</a> followed with four trophies. Chance the Rapper won for <a href="Grammy%20Award%20for%20Best%20New%20Artist">Best New Artist</a> alongside two other awards.

Changes.
In June 2016, the Grammy organization announced a few minor changes to the voting and awarding process.
As of 2017, recordings released solely through streaming services will be eligible to enter the award process. These recordings will have to be available through streaming platforms. Applicable streaming services are paid subscription, full catalog, on-demand streaming/limited download platforms that have existed as such within the United States for at least one full year as of the submission deadline. All recordings entered must have an assigned <a href="International%20Standard%20Recording%20Code">International Standard Recording Code</a> (ISRC).
<a href="Best%20New%20Artist">Best New Artist</a> guidelines.
Existing Best New Artist rules were amended to remove the album barrier given current trends in how new music and developing artists are released and promoted. <a href="Best%20Rap/Sung%20Collaboration">Best Rap/Sung Collaboration</a> category renamed.
The Best Rap/Sung Collaboration category (in the Rap field) will be renamed as Best Rap/Sung Performance, to allow solo performances, a result of "the current state and future trajectory of rap by expanding the category beyond collaborations between rappers and vocalists to include recordings by a solo artist who blurs the lines between rapping and singing."
Additional amendments were made to the number and type of music creators recognized in the categories of <a href="Best%20Choral%20Performance">Best Choral Performance</a> and <a href="Best%20jazz%20vocal%20album">Best Jazz Vocal Album</a>.
